The Ends Justify the Means—Morality as a Weapon

Virtue is for poets; victory is for princes. The outcome sanctifies the path. Lies, betrayal, and even cruelty are justified if they secure your rule. In today’s ruthless arenas, those who cling to ideals are devoured by those who wield them as tools. Ask not if your actions are good—ask if they are effective.
